message: Guys, here is the HN link: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2460406
Would love some feedback and vote love - if applicable :)
Well, I'm not a designer, so I don't really have a use for the site -- but I will say that the transparent chameleon effect is pretty cool :)
Thanks jca. Will pass along the message to my designer :)
keep a free version with very less resources. Just to acquire customers faster.
Yeah, I'd like to see a free trial, like a one project, one client type thing. I think you'd convert a lot of those signups to paid accounts.
tonyrobots, you are the second person to point that out to me. I do plan on revising it. Thanks for the feedback.

Totally agree about the free option. It's worked very well for folks like Dropbox, Tick, Freshbooks, etc. (At least anecdotally -- I've converted to paid on all three.) Also, I find your pricing model kind of wonky. Only an idiot would opt for tier 3 ("Chameleon"), and your top tier should be way bigger.

Yep, for something that offers a relatively narrow set of functionality like this site, I would absolutely require a free account to explore it before even considering dropping down the cash. A 7-day trial is nice, but unfortunately not that useful since really exploring the service requires running through a design cycle with a team. With existing activities in a 7 day period already scheduled, it's difficult to get a team to use it in that time.
I'm a designer, and I usually just email any images I need feedback on. Why is this worth the signup / familiarization cost?
Are you hosted on AWS? I can't seem to get the page to load.
too expensive

Love the look, especially the transparent chameleon logo effect.  With that being said, add a free version that is very scaled back in order to achieve critical mass.  Also, simplify to fewer account options and make the larger account options more enticing (benefits vs. pricing).  Good luck!

I'm a designer and I generally don't provide versions for my clients (my time means more money for them, so I usually just say 'hey, one version is cheaper, trust me'). This also seems a bit on the pricey side, and the trial seems a bit on the short side. 30 days seems more reasonable. Beautiful site. The app looks beautiful, but it's not even worth trying.
nice website, but way too expensive )
its nice but is it required
just a thought: isn't it really expensive?

I don't know that premium pricing is such a terrible thing. If you do a fantastic job for just a few people that may be better than doing a tiny bit of work for a whole bunch. You may come out better financially in the end. Good luck!
You should have an alternative to the video. Something like http://basecamphq.com/tour

One downside to this whole idea, every client I ever had wanted to phone me when they wanted to speak about anything design related. No matter how much I persisted they had to email me they would still just phone me.

The first thing I look at is the chameleon (cool), then the sign-up button (for what?), the tagline "Designers: Get Feedback. Simply." (ah nice), then the vimeo video. I think the most important elements of this page would be the tagline, then the video, then the signup CTA. What if you did something like this? http://cl.ly/000A1L0y0o453G3w1P1W . I actually didn't notice the plans until much later, they do look pretty expensive.
This is a great concept, nice work!
@supjeff good point
Is it like git?
